timeline.bodyHTML:
We try to avoid using the 'org.apache.commons' when possible, and here you can rewrite this as:

private static final String GBFS_JSON_FILENAME = "gbfs.json";
:
return url.endsWith(GBFS_JSON_FILENAME)
        ? url.substring(0, url.length() - GBFS_JSON_FILENAME.length())
        : url;

timeline.body: The url is configurable, ref that not our url.
timeline.bodyText: The url is configurable, ref that not our url.
timeline.bodyHTML: The url is configurable, ref that not our url.
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: The endpoint url is configurable, but the component that provides the API is open source and located at that url. This is useful if someone else wants to set up their own bikeservice deployment.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

replies.bodyText: Sorry, missed the fact that this is pointing to the implementation, not the running service.
replies.author: t2gran

timeline.author: t2gran

changed_code.chunk:
@@ -196,6 +195,20 @@ public class RouterConfig implements Serializable {
       .summary(
         "The maximimg time a street routing request is allowed to take before returning a timeout."
       )
-      .asDuration2(DEFAULT_STREET_ROUTING_TIMEOUT, ChronoUnit.SECONDS);
+      .description(
+        """
+In OTP1 path searches sometimes toke a long time to complete. With the new Raptor algorithm this not
+the case anymore. The street part of the routing may still take a long time if searching very long
+distances. You can set the street routing timeout to avoid tying up server resources on pointless
+searches and ensure that your users receive a timely response. You can also limit the max distance
+to search for WALK, BIKE and CAR. When a search times out, a WARN level log entry is made with
+information that can help identify problematic searches and improve our routing methods. There are
+no timeouts for the transit part of the routing search, instead configure a reasonable dynamic
+search-window.
+
+The search abort after this duration and any paths found are returned to the client.
+"""
+      )
+      .asDuration(DEFAULT_STREET_ROUTING_TIMEOUT);
   }
 }

@@ -206,7 +226,7 @@ information that can help identify problematic searches and improve our routing
 no timeouts for the transit part of the routing search, instead configure a reasonable dynamic
 search-window.
 
-The search abort after this duration and any paths found are returned to the client.
+The search aborts after this duration and any paths found are returned to the client.
 """
       )
       .asDuration(DEFAULT_STREET_ROUTING_TIMEOUT);

commits_in_main.message: Transmodel GraphQL API - Add config parameter `transmodelApi.hideFeedId` to be able to remove the system property "transmodel.graphql.api.agency.id".
Add API endpoint for fetching Mapbox Vector Tiles
Clean code: Rename UpdaterParameters to UpdatersParameters.

Support for versioning the configuration files #3282 - Added ApiServerInfo API classes to the REST API, the api is changed. - Fix bug in Maven Version parsing. The parser did not account for multiple dashes (`-`) in the qualifier. - Fix bug in Graph Serialization version comparison, commit hash was part of the compare and made every graph be incompatible.
Make it possible to configure maximum length for a flex transfer
Return config type for sandbox code
Add possibility to add tags to micrometer GraphQL tracing from headers
Move logic into its own class
refactor: Reorder the content of all Java classes with IntelliJ
refactor: Change the type of "streetRoutingTimeout" to Duration
feat: Allow the same config node to be accessed twice.
refactor: Make NodeAdaptor part of root config objects - this is needed later to output doc.
feature: Add support for adding documentation to NodeAdapter
review: Fix parse error in updaters
test: Add test for validation of router-config
refactor: The NodeBuilder is in heavy use, hence make the method names short and precise.
refactor: Fix RouterConfigurationDocTest, did generate BuildConfig, not RouterConfig
doc: Move streetRoutingTimeout doc to code
doc: Move requestLogFile doc to code
doc: Move div transit doc to code
refactor: DRY - Share description for configVersion in otp-, build-, and router-config.
refactor: Rename package routingrequest to routerequest
doc: Add links to RouteRequest.md and RoutingModes.md
refactor: Rename ItineraryFiltersMapper, RouteRequestMapper and WheelchairAccessibilityRequestMapper from Mapper to Config
Do not store routerConfig in DefaultServerRequestContext
refactor: Move Raptor to o.o.raptor package
Move form FlexParameters to using FlexConfig
refactor: Remove cyclic dependencies in datastore module

timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Can the gbfsBikeRentalServiceDirectory  part of the UpdaterConfig?
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: It could, but the reason I decided to separate them was to keep router-config json loading completely separate from the reading of this endpoint.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

replies.bodyText: The routerConfig.getBikeShareUpdaterEndpoint() is just reading the config, not reading the endpoint. There is a mismatch here witch make people ask? Why do we need to pass in two config objects, when the UpdaterConfig exist as the "All the GraphUpdaterConfigurator need to know" role?
replies.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: It depends on whether we want to UpdaterConfig to have the role of reading all config from all sources, or the role of reading config from json specifically, as is stated in the javadoc.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

replies.bodyText: The bikeShareUpdaterEndpoint parameter is in the JSON file.
replies.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: I see what you mean now. That method is reading the config, which is an endpoint, just for the configuration. I see that I already rename it to getBikeRentalServiceDirectoryUrl.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

changed_code.chunk:
@@ -1,7 +0,0 @@
-package org.opentripplanner.standalone.server;
-
-/**
- * Represents the configuration of a single router (a single graph for a specific geographic area)
- * in an OTP server.
- */
-public class Router {}

commits_in_main.message: Transmodel GraphQL API - Add config parameter `transmodelApi.hideFeedId` to be able to remove the system property "transmodel.graphql.api.agency.id".

Major cleanup Transmodel GraphQL API  - Cleanup (un)preferred/while/black agency and route filters in RoutingRequest  - Break TransmodelMappingUtil into smaller unit with less resposibillities  - Move Scalars to their own package  - Move each GraphQL entity into separate definition classes. Standarise referenceing.  - Make a new GqlUtil witch can be shard by all the GraphQL Entity types.  - Get rid of the index name, the Transmodel API is not just an index, it include routing as well.
Move from using AvgTimer to Micrometer in RAPTOR
Add possibility to add tags to micrometer GraphQL tracing from headers
Use global meter registry, and bind ActuatorAPI to it
fix: DateTime not set correct if missing in request #3713
Pass in registry when creating Router
refactor: Wire-up shutdown hook for Raptor and OTPServer.cleanupWebapp()
refactor: Reorder the content of all Java classes with IntelliJ
Read max slope from default routing request
refactor: Restrict API Resource assess by introducing OtpServerContext
refactor: Replace Router and OTPServer with a sever context.

timeline.message: Rename package to not use underscores
Use URI data type for endpoint config

timeline.body: This parameter need documentation in the Configuration.md - Not much, but clearly stated that it is a Sandbox feature.
timeline.bodyText: This parameter need documentation in the Configuration.md - Not much, but clearly stated that it is a Sandbox feature.
timeline.bodyHTML: This parameter need documentation in the Configuration.md - Not much, but clearly stated that it is a Sandbox feature.
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText:
I added a config parameter for the TransmodelAPI today, this is how I did it:
Configuration.md:

transmodelApi | configure Entur Transmodel API (Sandbox) | object | null | See the code for parameters, no doc provided.

This allow us to add as many parametes as needed later, and the parameter is extracted in the RouterConfiglike this:
this.transmodelApiHideFeedId = adapter.path("transmodelApi").asBoolean("hideFeedId", false);
I did not create a POJO for the one parameter - I will do that next time I add a new parameter, but the JSON structure account for such change.
replies.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: I have added documentation in Configuration.md for this now
replies.author: gmellemstrand

commits_in_main.message: Clean code: Delete redundant wrapper UpdaterDataSourceConfig.java  and add an enum for data-source-types to enable passing the type from the configuration to the updater implementation without adding a cyclic dependency.

timeline.body: The boxing here is unnecessary - I will remove it.
timeline.bodyText: The boxing here is unnecessary - I will remove it.
timeline.bodyHTML: The boxing here is unnecessary - I will remove it.
timeline.author: t2gran

commits_in_main.message: Initial commit of SIRI-reimplementation from OTP1
Clean code: Rename all config loaders from "Parameter" to "Config", "Parameter" is the role the play, not what they do.
Clean code: Rename UpdaterParameters to UpdatersParameters.
Clean code: Rename updater "name" to "configRef", and make sure the actual ref is injected. The ref should only be used for user interaction like logging.
Clean code: Make sure the updater interfaces are used in 'org.opentripplanner.updater' package, not the implementation from the 'org.opentripplanner.standalone.config' package.
Clean code: Move PollingGraphUpdaterParameters out of containing class. This interface is used in many places and is not local the PollingGraphUpdater.
Clean code: Cleanup the BikeParkDataSource configuration.
Fix and clean code: Cleanup the (GTFS HTTP/File) PollingStoptimeUpdater configuration.
Clean code: Cleanup the GtfsRealtimeAlertsUpdater configuration.
Clean code: Cleanup the WFSNotePollingGraphUpdater configuration.
Clean code: Cleanup the MqttGtfsRealtimeUpdater configuration.
Clean code: Cleanup the WebsocketGtfsRealtimeUpdater configuration.
Clean code: Delete the Sandbox updater examples, there are real-life updaters in the Sandbox now.
Make json tags for BikeRentalServiceDirectoryUrl configureable
Make sure BikeRentalServiceDirectoryFetcher is only run if URL is specificed
Rename bike rental -> vehicle rental in updaters
Rename bike park updater classes to vehicle parking
Initialize datasource outside of vehiclerentalupdater constructor
refactor: Reorder the content of all Java classes with IntelliJ
Solve some merge conflicts after transit model refactor
Improve logging of GBFS parsing errors
refactor: Move logFrequency, maxSnapshotFrequency, purgeExpiredData to timetableUpdates in config

timeline.body: The getData method should be refactored to take in a type-safe argument when we have it. I will fix this.
timeline.bodyText: The getData method should be refactored to take in a type-safe argument when we have it. I will fix this.
timeline.bodyHTML: The getData method should be refactored to take in a type-safe argument when we have it. I will fix this.
timeline.author: t2gran

commits_in_main.message: Clean code: Rename updater "name" to "configRef", and make sure the actual ref is injected. The ref should only be used for user interaction like logging.

Clean code: Delete redundant wrapper UpdaterDataSourceConfig.java  and add an enum for data-source-types to enable passing the type from the configuration to the updater implementation without adding a cyclic dependency.
Make json tags for BikeRentalServiceDirectoryUrl configureable
Use the provided url for GBFS auto-discovery
Allow http headers to be configured for bike rental updaters
Rename bike rental -> vehicle rental in updaters

timeline.message: Small code cleanups - fix compilation error.
